inlineContent.text: This library offers a DSL (Domain Specific Language) to build predicates and requests to fetch a CoreData store. There are three objectives it tries to reach:
Use compiler-checking to evaluate predicates and avoid runtime errors.
Writing a request and especially a predicate should feel as natural as possible in Swift.
to fetch a CoreData store should be left behind.

abstract.text: Identifies a step where a sort step can be applied.
The request has a target (first, first nth, all).
Namespace to hide most building types used by SafeFetching to make requests.
Learn how to build requests with the SafeFetching DSL.
Type that can be used as the result of a fetch request.
A step in the fetch request building process.

to offer fetching using SafeFetching API.
Quick overview to start using SafeFetching and write fetch requests the easy way.
A type implementing this protocol can be used in a SafeFetching predicate when fetching a CoreData store.
Stores types and identifier of an entity and attribute or relationship that can be used for fetching.
Learn how to safely specify predicates when building a request.
